I am an Indian, and in India we follow the metric system, as such. I used to have some difficulty navigating through the units, and thought of converting ft to m and mile to km, etc. But then 1 J = 1 Kg * (1 m/s)^2, so dimensions of energy are mass into velocity squared. So in imperial units, with the base units being pound (lb), feet (ft) and second, the dimensions of energy still remain mass into velocity squared i.e. lb into ft^2/s^2. The best you can do to save time is convert mph to fps and everything to the base units of the system being used. For reference, 1 yard = 3 feet 220 yards = 1 furlong 8 furlongs = 1 mile, so 1 mile = 220*8*3 ft = 5280 feet. (please correct me, if this is wrong, I'm not too sure) As for uncommon units like slugs, stones etc. convert them to the base imperial unit, i.e. pound and you should be all good. My suggestion is don't bother to convert between imperial to metric and vice versa as you'll waste a lot of time. Just convert all units to the base units of the system being used. Rest is up to you. Cheers :D
